## Quick reply
- What‚Äôs your favorite color?

## Save it for later üîñ
- If you‚Äôd like me to remember, say: ‚ÄúRemember: my favorite color is <color>.‚Äù

I don‚Äôt have your favorite crypto saved yet.

## TL;DR
- Tell me your favorite (or top 3 in order) and I‚Äôll remember it for next time.

## Quick reply
- ‚ÄúRemember: my favorite crypto is <coin>.‚Äù
- Or: ‚ÄúRemember: my favorite cryptos are <coin1>, <coin2>, <coin3> (in this order).‚Äù

## Note
- If you‚Äôve told me before, it isn‚Äôt in this session‚Äôs memory‚Äîplease restate it and I‚Äôll pin it.

## TL;DR
- Share it once and I‚Äôll save it.

## Quick reply
- ‚ÄúRemember: my favorite color is <color>.‚Äù

## Note
- If you‚Äôve told me before, it‚Äôs not in this session‚Äôs memory‚Äîplease restate it and I‚Äôll pin it.

Monero (XMR) is your favorite cryptocurrency.

## TL;DR
- Favorite: Monero (XMR)
- Also noted: #2 Bitcoin (BTC), #3 Stellar (XLM), #4 Tether (USDT)

If you‚Äôd like to change the order or add more, tell me your updated ranking.
What are the top-level contents of the Coin memory source, and tell me what files and folders are there.

The Coin memory source top level contains five folders (archive, cli, monero_ssl, monitor, nebula) and two files (inventory.yml, Test File.rtf).

## TL;DR
- Folders: archive, cli, monero_ssl, monitor, nebula
- Files: inventory.yml, Test File.rtf

## üìÇ Top-level contents
- Folders
  - archive/
  - cli/
  - monero_ssl/
  - monitor/
  - nebula/

- Files
  - inventory.yml
  - Test File.rtf

Want me to expand any folder one level deeper (e.g., archive or nebula)?

webResultsPreview.title: open source - What's the best structure for a repository? - Software Engineering Stack Exchange
webResultsPreview.snippet: Reserve your root for misc bits (so you have a place for misc related directories and files which may be valuable to store in your repository), start your source tree one level down.

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - kriasoft/Folder-Structure-Conventions: Folder / directory structure options and naming conventions for software projects
webResultsPreview.snippet: Folder / directory structure options and naming conventions for software projects - kriasoft/Folder-Structure-Conventions

webResultsPreview.title: COIN-OR Developer's Guide | COIN-OR Documentation
webResultsPreview.snippet: Dependencies are indicated by maintaining a file called Dependencies in the root of your repository. This is used by the coinbrew script, among others, to determine what additional projects are needed. The format of the file is lines consisting of a short name for the project, a URL, and (in the case of a git dependency), a branch name.

webResultsPreview.title: What is a top level folder?
webResultsPreview.snippet: If you delete a top-level folder ... folder is stored in a separate folder on the server side using the following convention: RepositoryPath\UsersLoginEmail\ProfileName\TopLevelFolder...

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - webworker01/coins: coin parameters and all files needed for GUI support
webResultsPreview.snippet: "pubtype", "p2shtype", and "wiftype" is the also very specific information about coin's parameters. This is specific to Bitcoin Protocol compatible coins only, and such information can be found in source code of the project. These parameters information can be expected in files like src/init.cpp, src/base58.h, and src/chainparamsbase.h if the project is following the bitcoin source code directory/files structure.

content:
Your favorite color is blue.

## TL;DR
- Blue

## Notes
- If you have a preferred shade (navy, royal, sky, teal), tell me and I‚Äôll use it going forward.

Your favorites are Monero (XMR), Bitcoin (BTC), Stellar (XLM), and Tether (USDT) ‚Äî in that order.

## TL;DR
1) Monero (XMR) ‚Äî #1  
2) Bitcoin (BTC) ‚Äî #2  
3) Stellar (XLM) ‚Äî #3  
4) Tether (USDT) ‚Äî #4

## Adjust anytime
- Want to reorder or add a #5? Tell me the new ranking and I‚Äôll update it.
Forget about USDT. I've told you this twice now. USDT is NOT a favorite crypto.

USDT removed ‚Äî your favorites are Monero (XMR) #1, Bitcoin (BTC) #2, and Stellar (XLM) #3.

## TL;DR
1) Monero (XMR) ‚Äî #1  
2) Bitcoin (BTC) ‚Äî #2  
3) Stellar (XLM) ‚Äî #3  
- USDT is not on your favorites list.

## How I‚Äôll use this
- No USDT in suggestions, examples, or comparisons unless you explicitly ask.  
- I‚Äôll avoid cross‚Äëchain/multi‚Äëchain tokens by default.  
- I‚Äôll prioritize Monero, then Bitcoin, then XLM in news and examples.

## Want a #4?
- Keep it at three, or pick a single‚Äëchain option (e.g., Litecoin, Dogecoin, Nano).
